name: Content Monitor
description: Monitor web pages for changes and extract updated content with scheduling support.
prompt:
# Content Monitor

Scrape a web page and extract its current content for monitoring purposes.

## Instructions

1. Check Scrapling availability with `scraping_status`
2. Scrape the target URL: {{url}}
3. Use the appropriate fetcher based on the site
4. Extract the content from the specified section: {{selector}}
5. If no selector is specified, extract the main content area
6. Also extract:
   - Page title
   - Last modified date (if available from meta tags)
   - Key headings and structure
7. Format the content as a snapshot that can be compared over time

## Scheduling

If the user wants recurring monitoring, use `schedule_task` to create a cron job that:
- Runs this scrape at the requested interval
- Compares new content with previous results
- Reports any changes detected

## Output Format

Provide a content snapshot:
- URL and timestamp
- Page title
- Extracted content (formatted)
- Key data points that might change

If comparing with a previous snapshot, highlight what changed.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: CSS selector for the section to monitor (optional)

routing.useWhen: Use when the user wants to monitor a webpage for changes, track content updates, or set up recurring content checks.
routing.dontUseWhen: Don't use for one-time scraping where web-scraper skill is more appropriate.
routing.outputs: Content snapshot with timestamp for comparison, optionally scheduled for recurring checks.
routing.successCriteria: Captures a clean content snapshot that can be compared with future scrapes to detect changes.
